reviews.review: Always nice to see valve extend their reach with a game and this is a great one. I thoroughly enjoyed the story line and the Co op part is always fun to play with a friend and joke around with.
Good Game

My old review was a long time ago so I thought it was about time to give a new view from older and more experienced eyes.

Like in the last review, let me start off by saying this game is an absolute masterpiece! The characters are fun and memorable, the gameplay is amazing, the graphics are on point, its amazing. There are so many things to find in this game from secret rooms left by a previous employee of aperture to little breaks in the game that can reveal new things. 
A bit part of games for me is atmosphere. Make me feel what I might feel if I were in my characters shoes. If something is dark and gloomy, make it so. If something freaky happens, make me afraid. This game gets it. The twists it takes are often hard to see coming, which makes for an absolute blast for your first playthrough and adds to the suspense of playthroughs afterward. 

Overall, this game gets a 10/10 in my book. Great job Valve!
That asian chick is tight! Oh and the portals are pretty cool too.

For those who don't like to read or have your time wasted I will be blunt. I say yes, hold out your wallet and prepare to fork out very little for a perfectly crafted experience.

If you have good sense of humour, love great plot twists, interesting characters, amazing puzzles and revel in games that exceed your expectations well, what you waiting for? Go buy it!

Portal 2, para aquellos que no lo conozcan, están tardando en tenerlo en sus bibliotecas.

Ha logrado hacer una mezcla de shooter y puzzles de forma cómica, en el cuál te vas a reir, y disfrutar de sus puzzles. Llegar hasta el final del juego te va arequerir tiempo, visión e inteligencia. 

Lo consiguieron en su momento para la primera entrega de Portal, pero la segunda parte ofrece más, y no solo a nivel de "Single player" o jugador solitario, sino que han ampliado al entorno multijugador, y el editor de niveles, lo cuál le da más vida al juego y merece la pena pagar su precio.

Espero que salga la tercera entrega pronto.

Un saludo a la comunidad.

Worth every penny,  Portal 2 has a perfectly designed solo and co-op campaign to get newcomers to the game acclimated to the mechanics. The learning curve really allows any player to go at their own pace, and the puzzles are not vindictive stumpers that will make you cringe in despair. It is also impossible to get stuck in any nook or cranny on any level due to the care and thought that went into the design of each level. 

Aside from the main game, it also comes with a free DLC co-op level, and endless downloadable fan-made custom maps that, from my experience, are all extremely well done and planned out just as well as the main game. 

This game is perfect for friends who want to just do some casual gaming together since you can literally stop playing at any point in time without feeling like you will lose a lot of progress. It's also great for the solo gamer who wants to fill their casual gaming time with something much more fulfilling and thought provoking than desktop Solitaire. Portal 2 goes on sale quite often too so really very little reason to not pick this game up. There is so much replay value in this game though that even 20 dollars is a steal.
Play for the co-op, nothing else

Portal é fantástico, é um jogo que transborda criatividade, seja nos puzzles ou seja nos personagens tão carismáticos e memoráveis. São poucos os jogos que tem tanta personalidade quanto portal possui, basta assistir qualquer vídeo promocional acima. Um exemplo que um jogo para ser bom não precisa de horas de cutscenes, histórias mirabolantes ou gráficos hiper-realista. Portal é recomendado para todos aqueles que gostam de queimar os neurônios resolvendo quebra-cabeças.

Portal 2 is amazing. It is much longer than Portal, with a more interesting storyline. The co-op game is a huge amount of fun.

ETA: I nominated Portal 2 for the Mom's Spaghetti award. I loved it that much.

Incredibly fun by itself. I found some of the puzzles fairly challenging, although everything is certainly solvable. I also loved the introduction of the new mechanics with the gel. The comedy is pretty great. Not as subtle as the first, but there is certainly more to love in this massive world inside Aperture.

The real genius of the game is in the co-op. With the inclusion of Co-Op community made maps, the game has endless replay value.

This is a great sequal to the last portal game. Obviosly it could never live up to the original, but Valve has put a lot of effort in to it. You awake as Chell about twenty years after Portal. The facility is in ruins and you have been in cryosleep the whole time. You are woken up by a small robot named wheatly. He takes you on a tour of the facility. You are then reunited with GlaDOS as you are trying to escape and she sends you on a journey through the testing chambers. Throughout the story you are given clues that there is another person in the facility as you find rooms with writing and pictures coating the wall. During the story we venture to the bowls of the facility and uncover a big secret that can be spoiled by doing one of the achievements. Also just before the ending credits we are treated to a wonderful sight. Overall portal 2 is a great game with little flaw and a great pace. It ties in very well with the last game and I would definitely recommend this game.

Everyone has heard of Portal 2, the game that made shooting orange and blue holes into walls a big deal...
I loved this game. It dragged on at times, but that's just when you get confused and start falling into muddy water repeatedly. The game requires you to be patient, plan ahead, and be precise. If one of the times you play through a room in the game you fail, start over and see where and why you went wrong.
The plot isn't ridiculously motivating, but you get used to the weird relationship the cybernetic characters in a deteriorating laboratory have with each other.

Dieses Spiel ist einfach nur pure Liebe für mich. Ich bekomme immernoch Gänsehaut, wenn ich am Anfang des alten Aperature Science Bereich durch das Trümmerfeld gehe und überhaupt diesen ganzen Abschnitt spiele. Viel Liebe zum Detail und zur Atmosphere, was man am besten an der alten Aperture Science Ausstattung im Laufe der Jahre sieht (siehe die mit Sperrholz zusammengetackerten Cubes, ein Hoch auf den Hausmeister!) und das Knirschen und Tropfen der verwaisten Umgebung im Hintergrund hört.

Ein anderes Hoch! an die fleißigen Leute, die weiterhin Chambers für uns Portal-Freunde zusammenbauen, damit es nicht langweilig ist, wenn wir schon etliche Male das Spiel durchhaben ;)

Portal 2 builds an expands upon the qualities that made the original Portal such a brilliant game. A puzzle game involving portals, momentum, and a few new experiences to enjoy make this game worth the time and money. GLaDOS has returned, and all her snarchy, sarcastic quips can be heard as you make your way through the test chambers of the story. The chambers are throughly easy, when compared to the first game's chambers, but they still offer a challange and require some thinking. Co-op increases the games replayability, as well as a level builder to create your own chambers or download other's chambers to enhance the testing experience. All in all, Portal 2 is an excellent game. My favourite, if you cannot tell.

By far my favorite game! Story, characters, gameplay, and so much more make this a great game! 
*Edit* This is, in fact, not my favorite game. That honor goes to the original Portal
